title: How to Check Lemons and Heavy Cream Freshness

items.name: Checking lemon freshness - Feel
items.details: Should be firm with slight give when squeezed. If rock-hard or super mushy/shriveled, discard.

items.name: Checking lemon freshness - Look
items.details: Skin should be bright yellow with only minor blemishes. Green or white fuzzy mold means toss it. Wrinkly skin is OK if not too soft inside.

items.name: Checking lemon freshness - Smell
items.details: Should smell citrusy and clean. If it smells sour in a fermented or off way, discard.

items.name: Checking lemon freshness - Cut test
items.details: Inside should be juicy and clear. If dry, brownish, or has mold inside, discard.

items.name: Whole lemons fridge life
items.details: 3-4 weeks in the fridge, sometimes longer if super fresh. Keep in crisper drawer or sealed bag to retain moisture.

items.name: Cut lemons fridge life
items.details: 3-5 days in the fridge if wrapped tightly or stored in an airtight container.

items.name: Organic heavy whipping cream after opening
items.details: Good for 5-7 days in the fridge, up to 10 days max if very fresh and stored properly (sealed tightly, kept cold). Check smell (not sour/funky), texture (smooth, not chunky/separated), and taste (rich and clean, not tangy).

notes: Even before expiration dates, always trust your senses -- if smell, texture, or taste seem off, discard the item.
